work.p: The manuscript is written as aphoristic fragments connected by elipses, in the manner of the Preface to the first edition of Leaves of Grass (1855)

titleStmt.title: One obligation of great fresh bards
a machine readable transcription
titleStmt.author: Walt Whitman
titleStmt.sponsor: Center for Digital Research in the Humanities, University of Nebraska-Lincoln
titleStmt.funder: The National Endowment for the Humanities

notesStmt.note: Because the manuscript has not been located it is difficult to speculate on the circumstances or date of its composition. Edward Grier notes that "[t]he thought and the punctuation suggest the Preface of 1855," so it is likely that the composition date was before or early in 1855.

biblStruct.note: Grier derives this text from Notes & Fragments, ed. Richard Maurice Bucke (London, Ontario: A. Talbot & Co., printers, 1899), 124.

bibl.author: Walt Whitman
bibl.title: One Obligation
bibl.orgName: The location of this manuscript is unknown.

revisionDesc.change: reconciled with EAD record; added Work ID
checked, added date to bibl (from finding aid information)

body.p: One obligation of great fresh bards remains . . . the clink of words is empty and offensive . . . the poetic quality blooms simple and earnest as the laws of the world.
The audible rhyme soon nauseates . . . the inaudible rhyme is delicious without end.
